etymology.description: 八(八) (bā, "to divide") + 牛(牛) (niú, "cow") = to cut a cow into two halves -> half
etymology.interpretation: The character 半(半) (bàn, "half") combines 八(八) (bā, "to divide") and 牛(牛) (niú, "cow") to symbolize dividing an object into two equal parts, similar to cutting a cow in half. This reflects the basic meaning of 'half'.

examples.chinese: 这块蛋糕只剩一半(這塊蛋糕只剩一半)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè kuài dàngāo zhǐ shèng yī bàn.
examples.english: This piece of cake only has half left.

examples.chinese: 半个小时后(半個小時後)，他到达了(他到達了)。
examples.pinyin: Bàn gè xiǎoshí hòu, tā dào dá le.
examples.english: He arrived after half an hour.

examples.chinese: 会议只进行到一半(會議只進行到一半)，就结束了(就結束了)。
examples.pinyin: Huìyì zhǐ jìnxíng dào yī bàn, jiù jiéshù le.
